abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the loan is
            to support the expansion and development of Costa
            Rica's exports, by facilitating increased utilization
            of installed capacity and assisting in the opening up of new
            markets outside the CACM. The proposed loan would support
            the Government's export development program through: i)
            establishment of a revolving Export Financing Fund (FOPEX)
            in the Central Bank to help ensure adequate access of
            exporters to foreign exchange for imported inputs; ii)
            provision through FOPEX of short-term financing for both
            imported and local inputs; iii) strengthening the
            Government's export promotion policy framework; and iv)
            provision of technical assistance to the Government and its
            Export Promotion and Investment Center (CENPRO) to
            strengthen export and investment promotion efforts and
            services to exporters. By providing exporters with timely
            and adequate access to foreign exchange, the proposed loan
            is expected to facilitate improved capacity utilization in
            export and industries, thus generating new employment and income.
